intro: Eschscholzia vernalis, commonly known as the spring poppy, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its striking, bright orange or red petals and a narrow, elongated seed pod. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky soils. It blooms in the early spring, often before the leaves fully develop. Eschscholzia vernalis is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppy species.
